p.strong:
HELLO AND WELCOME TO OUR SURVEY!
YOUR OPINIONS ARE VERY IMPORTANT TO US AND THANK YOU IN ADVANCE FOR YOUR PARTICIPATION.
PLEASE ANSWER EACH QUESTION CAREFULLY AND COMPLETELY. REMEMBER THERE ARE NO RIGHT OR WRONG ANSWERS.
USE THE SCROLL BAR ON THE RIGHT AND BOTTOM OF YOUR SCREEN TO MOVE UP AND DOWN THROUGH QUESTIONS AND IMAGES.
LET’S BEGIN…

radio.label: S_Gender
radio.title: With which gender do you identify?

checkbox.label: S_Industry
checkbox.title: Do you or does any member of your household work in any of these occupational fields?
checkbox.row: Advertising agency or public relations firms
A graphic design or packaging firm
A company involved in the manufacturing, distribution or sale of consumer packaged good products
A company involved in the manufacturing, distribution or sale of over-the-counter products/medications
The Food & Drug Administration, or Federal Trade Commission
Manufacturer, wholesaler, retailer, or distributor of drugs, healthcare or pharmaceutical products
A health care professional (Doctor, Nurse, Physician Assistant, Pharmacist)

term.label: TERM_Industry
term.cond: (S_Industry.r1 or S_Industry.r2 or S_Industry.r3 or S_Industry.r4 or S_Industry.r5 or S_Industry.r6 or S_Industry.r7 or S_Industry.r8)

select.label: S_GroceryShop
select.title: How much of your household’s shopping for healthcare products do you, yourself, do?

radio.label: S_Household
radio.title: Are there any children of yours living in your household who are 17 years of age or younger?

radio.label: S_Household_1
radio.title: How many children live in your household?

checkbox.label: S_Household_2
checkbox.title: How old are the children living in your household?

checkbox.label: S_Symptom
checkbox.title: Which, if any, of the following have you personally experienced within the past month?

term.label: TERM_Symptom
term.cond: not(S_Symptom.r2 or S_Symptom.r3 or S_Symptom.r4 or S_Symptom.r5 or S_Symptom.r6 or S_Symptom.r7 or S_Symptom.r11)

radio.label: S_Symptom2
radio.title: You mention that you experienced multiple symptoms within the past month. What symptom was most troublesome to your daily activities?

radio.label: S_SymptomSeverity
radio.title: Which of the following best described the severity of your symptom(s) when experiencing [pipe: S_Symptom] in the past month?

checkbox.label: S_Condition
checkbox.title: For the symptom(s) you mention that you have experienced within the past month, which of the following health conditions were you experiencing?
checkbox.row: I don't know what condition I had

checkbox.label: S_Condition2
checkbox.title: What makes you think you were experiencing [pipe: S_Condition]?
checkbox.row: I was diagnosed by a medical professional (i.e. doctor, nurse practitioner, etc.)
I guessed based on the symptom(s) I had
Someone I was exposed to was diagnosed with [pipe: S_Condition]

radio.label: S_CondSeverity
radio.title: Which of the following best described the severity of your illness when experiencing [pipe: S_Condition] in the past month?
radio.row: I don't know what condition I had

checkbox.label: S_SickBehavior
checkbox.title: Once you realized you were starting to feel sick, which of the following, if any, did you do?
checkbox.row: I bought product(s) to help treat my symptoms
I started taking vitamins or supplements to boost my immunity

checkbox.label: S_SickBehavior2
checkbox.title: Was there anything else you did while you were sick?
checkbox.row: I bought product(s) to help treat my symptoms*
I started taking vitamins or supplements to boost my immunity

checkbox.label: S_Products
checkbox.title: Which types of products have you purchased to manage your [pipe: S_Symptom] in the past month?
checkbox.row: Over the counter multi symptom cold/flu medication (e.g. DayQuil, NyQuil, Mucinex, etc.)
Prescribed cough, cold, or flu medication
Medicated nasal sprays (e.g. Afrin, Vick's, Sinex, Flonase, etc.)
Natural cold remedies such as vitamins or immunity support
Homeopathic / at-home remedies (e.g. essential oils, taking a hot shower, drinking tea, etc.)
Nasal washes/rinses (e.g. Neil Med Sinus Rinse, NetiPot, etc.)
I did not buy anything to relieve my symptoms in the past month

checkbox.label: S_Brand_PastPurchased
checkbox.title: Which brand(s) of [pipe: S_Products] and/or treatments did you purchase and use when you were most recently experiencing [pipe: S_Symptom] in the past month?
checkbox.group: Over the counter multi symptom cold/flu products/medications:
Prescribed cough, cold, or flu products/medications:

radio.label: S_PrimaryShopper
radio.title: How much of the shopping for over-the-counter products/medications do you do for yourself?

I do half of the shopping for myself
I do less than half of the shopping for myself

A combination of Online and In-store

They were delivered the same-day that I placed the order
I ordered them online and picked them up from inside the store
I ordered them online and picked-up curbside, without going in the store

radio.label: Agreement1
radio.title:
Respondent Confidentiality Disclosure Agreement (RCDA)
Congratulations!
Thank you for agreeing to participate in this consumer study on behalf of Behaviorally, formerly PRS. Before you can participate in this research, we would like you to understand that it will involve Confidential Information and you must agree to these terms and conditions. If you do not agree, you will not be eligible to participate in this study. By signing this agreement, you agree as follows:
You will use information or material disclosed to you or which may be available as part of this study only for the purpose of participating in this study, and you will not otherwise use the information or material for your own benefit or the benefit of any third party.
You agree to keep confidential and not disclose, copy, transmit, or use for any purpose other than your participation in this study any information or material disclosed or made available to you as part of the study, including about products or packaging that may be disclosed to you directly or indirectly by participating in this study. Any disclosure, copying, transmitting or misuse of any information or material in any form (including hard copy and/or electronic/data) whether intentional or unintentional may subject you to disqualification, and any other remedies available to Behaviorally or its study partners in law or equity.
You agree that Behaviorally (and its partners) will be irreparably harmed and monetary damages may not be adequate compensation if you fail to meet your obligations under this agreement, and that, in addition to other remedies, Behaviorally (or its partners) shall be entitled to seek injunctive relief to prevent any threatened or continued breach. The parties hereby waive any requirements for security for obtaining any provisional relief.
Each of Behaviorally’s partners is an intended third-party beneficiary of this agreement and each partner may enforce the terms of this agreement.
As further detailed in our privacy policy (https://www.behaviorally.com/privacy-policy), we take reasonable precautions to protect the privacy and security of your information during the market research survey. All information collected as part of this survey is treated in accordance with our online privacy policy and is destroyed 2 years after you have taken this survey. You will be compensated for your time, commitment, and confidential obligation.
Please confirm your acceptance of these terms by checking the agreement below.

row.label: r1
row.b: I hereby acknowledge and agree to the terms.

text.label: DateTime
text.title: DateTime
text.exec:
from datetime import datetime
cur_time = datetime.now() DateTime.val = cur_time.strftime("%m/%d/%Y %H:%M:%S")

survey.html: For the next set of questions, please think about when you last bought over-the counter [pipe:Category] from [pipe: S_Retailer_BUMO] [pipe: instoreOnline].

radio.label: Q_SHOP
radio.title: Thinking about the most recent time you bought [pipe:Category] at [pipe: S_Retailer_BUMO], when did you decide to buy it?

checkbox.label: Q_SHOP1B
checkbox.title: What made you decide to purchase [pipe:Category]?
checkbox.row: Someone in my household was experiencing symptoms
I was stocking up to be prepared
I was replenishing the products we use in my household – I had run out of cold/flu OTC products/medications
I was replenishing – I still had some at home but wanted to have more on hand
I was already at the store buying other things anyway
I saw an advertisement for the product
A coupon, promotion, or sale influenced me
Someone in my life, that is not a medical professional, recommended the product
A medical professional recommended the product

radio.label: Q_SHOP1C
radio.title: How long were you experiencing (pipe RESPONSE FROM S_CONDITIONPurchase) symptoms prior to shopping for [pipe:Category]?
radio.row: I was just starting to experience symptoms
I had been experiencing symptoms for a few days
I had been experiencing symptoms for a week or longer
I was starting to recover and feel better

checkbox.label: Q_SHOP1D
checkbox.title: Which of the following best describes the reasons why you waited to buy [pipe:Category]?
checkbox.row: The symptoms were not that serious
I was too busy and didn't have time to shop
I used natural remedies (i.e. honey, tea) instead of OTC medication
I wanted to avoid taking medication
I already had medication on hand at home
I wanted to wait for the symptoms to go away on their own
I was using home remedies to treat my symptoms
I didn't have time to purchase sooner
I was taking care of other ill household members
I saw a doctor who recommended I purchase medication to treat my symptoms

radio.label: Q_SHOP1E
radio.title: How many days did you wait before shopping for [pipe:Category]?

radio.label: Q_ProductSelection
radio.title: Did you have a specific product in mind before shopping for [pipe:Category]?
radio.row: Yes, I had a specific product in mind and I purchased that product
Yes, I had a specific product in mind but I was open to exploring other products
I had multiple products in mind and made up my mind while shopping
No, I did not have a specific product in mind and needed help to decide what was right for me

checkbox.label: Q_SHOP2
checkbox.title: Where did you conduct research, if any, before buying [pipe: S_Brand_PastPurchased]?
checkbox.row: At the store by looking at available products on the shelves
At the store by asking someone who works there
On my mobile phone while at the store
At home or another place (not at a store)
I did not do any research prior to buying [pipe:Category]

checkbox.label: Q_SHOP3
checkbox.title: Which of these sources did you use to do research for your purchase of [pipe: S_Brand_PastPurchased] at [pipe: S_Retailer_BUMO]?
checkbox.row: Recommendation from in-store professionals (i.e. pharmacist, store associate, etc.)
Recommendation from a healthcare professional (i.e. a doctor, nurse practitioner, etc.)
Recommendation from influencers, e.g. content creators on Instagram or Youtube.com
On social media (e.g, Instagram, Twitter, TikTok, etc.)
Online review and information websites and articles, e.g., WebMD.com, Mayoclinic.com, etc.
Online groups and discussion boards, e.g., reddit

textarea.label: Q_SHOP3A
textarea.title: You mentioned that you were influenced to buy [pipe: S_Brand_PastPurchased], from a content creator or influencer online. Who influenced you to make the purchase?
textarea.comment: Please be as specific as possible

checkbox.label: Q_RetailerFactors
checkbox.title: What are the reasons that you choose to buy [pipe:Category] at [pipe: S_Retailer_BUMO]?
checkbox.row: I already was placing an order from this store
I shop at this retailer for my usual household shopping

radio.label: Q_DecisionFactors_[loopvar: task]
radio.title:
Task [MDcount]/13
Thinking about when you were buying over the counter [pipe: Category] from a retailer, which factors were most and least important to your decision?
radio.comment: In this exercise you will see several different sets of five factors each. Some factors may get repeated over different sets. For each set, please select the factor that is most important and least important to you in that set. Please select only one factor for Most Important, and one factor for Least Important (Most Important and Least Important cannot be the same factor).

survey.html: Thank you for telling us about your experiences shopping for [pipe: Category]. For these next few questions, we’d like to understand how you felt after you finished your shopping trip.

radio.label: Q_Post1
radio.title: After taking [pipe: S_Brand_PastPurchased], how soon did you begin to feel fully better from [pipe: S_Symptom]?
radio.row: I did not feel full relief after taking the [pipe: S_Brand_PastPurchased] product

radio.label: Q_Post1B
radio.title: What did you do after you did not feel symptom relief after taking the medication you purchased?
radio.row: I bought a different product from the same brand(s) to treat my symptoms
I bought a similar product from different brand(s)
I waited for symptoms to go away on their own
I went to a doctor or other medical professional
I used other medication I had in my medicine cabinet
I used non-medicated remedies such as tea or herbal supplements

I didn't do anything after I felt symptom relief
